title: Gemma Collins enjoys strange midnight snack as she struggles to sleep over Arg drama
text:

Gemma Collins has revealed she is struggling to sleep following the dramatic recent events between her and ex boyfriend James "Arg" Argent .

She posted an Instagram story time stamped at 3:55am with the caption "Cant sleep".

To help ease her stress, Gemma tucked into a strange snack of rice krispies with hot milk heated on the hob.

She filmed the process for her followers with several boomerangs documenting her pouring the milk over her cereal.

She admitted at her fragrance launch earlier this week that stress was causing her to gain weight again after her incredible progress.

"I ain’t stopped eating", she said.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

"I’ve had a lot of stress and I’ve not been to the gym in two weeks.

“I’ve been unwell all weekend with a chest infection.”

This comes as Gemma's relationship with on/off boyfriend Arg is particularly strained, after she called paramedics to his home because she was fearing for his life.

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX/Shutterstock)

(Image: WireImage)

Arg has said of the incident on Thursday: "I wasn't speaking to a certain person so I didn't reply. They became concerned and called the police and ambulance. They turned up and checked on me. They came up to my room to make sure I was fine.

"My parents were already there. Then this person must have called again and the ambulance turned up at around 4pm and we had a quick chat on the doorstep. He said it was a lovely house.

"I wasn't speaking to this person for a reason and they were worried about my safety because I wasn't answering the phone. I was perfectly fine, we all had a chat and carried on the day with my parents, we were just hanging up pictures."

(Image: MirrorOnline)

(Image: LightRocket via Getty Images)

Arg added: “The police and paramedics were only here for about ten minutes. I'm slightly embarrassed really. I apologise for any wasted police time as I was absolutely fine."

In a statement, Metropolitan Police said: "Police were called at 13.11hrs to a residential address following concerns for the welfare of male occupant. Officers attended with LAS [London Ambulance Service]. The male, in his 30s, was spoken to. He was left in the company of family.

"Officers were called at 16.21hrs to the same address, again due to concerns for the same male's welfare. The male declined assistance."
description: At 4am this morning, Gemma ate a questionable snack of rice krispies with milk heated up on the hob
